content.webTitle: Nilsson wants to be sent to Coventry

fields.headline: Nilsson wants to be sent to Coventry
fields.bodyText: Coventry City's caretaker manager Roland Nilsson has admitted he would like the job on a permanent basis if the club's next few results are favourable. Nilsson was appointed by Coventry chairman Bryan Richardson this morning after the club announced Gordon Strachan's departure by mutual consent. And the 37-year-old Swede told Sky Sports News: "I'm just going to try and do the best I can. "Then after a few weeks we will have to reassess it again and see how it's going. If everything works out well it might suit me (to stay)." The former Sheffield Wednesday full-back has been pressed into action immediately and is busy prepaaring his sqaud for tomorrow's Worthington Cup tie at Peterborough. "My head is still spinning," he said. "I just had a phone call from the chairman last night who said he wanted to meet me this morning when he told me I'm taking charge."
